page.title: 06Local History-Uzmaston area
page.content: Hanton, Deeplake, Cook's, Black Backs, Have-a-Care and Millin BRIDGES are on Community Boundaries. All are over Millin Brook or its tributaries except Hanton which is across a stream from a spring on Old Oven Farm, known locally as Green Lake. Have-a-Care may be so named because Baron de Rutzen, a local landowner, shouted this to a workman during construction. Black Backs is in Black Backs Wood and a small area between this Bridge and Have-a-Care is known as Boulston Parlour. A field near the river is called Sheep Dock, perhaps a corruption of Shipping Dock where lime was unloaded from boats. The owners of Hanton Farm (2 Tumuli), Cedar House (Tumulus) and Norchard (Earthwork) are paid Â£50 annually to preserve Ancient Monuments on their land, unploughed.
